bow: hello moms can pick your brains little ones and weddings not mom but figured you guys might be great resource for me with this problem having wedding in months and at first wanted to have an adult only event because feel with my group of friends and flowing booze my wedding would be about as far from an appropriate place for kids as you could get without nudity but then once we made our guest list we realized that 90 of our guests were traveling and it was entirely unfair to ask them to leave the smaller kids at home as compromise we ve rented out our local zoo for the night as our venue this was for few reasons mostly because there is stuff to entertain the kids if they get bored and also so there is enough room to easily whisk them away from any inappropriate behavior that may and most likely will occur but we have decided to have cut off age for ceremony attendees the ceremony and reception are both at the zoo and the ceremony area is adjacent to the children learning center going to be hiring nanny or several depending on need for the 20 30 minutes of the ceremony and requesting that the younger kids be brought there what is the best way to address this with the parents we know know will never make everyone happy but am open to hearing any and all suggestions and would really appreciate your perspective on this thank you it amazing you have thought to hire nanny for the ceremony and think parents will absolutely love you for it in general with the weddings ve been to kids 3+ have so much fun dancing and eating that it usually more fun with them there teens will stick to themselves and stay on their phones ipads gameboys do those still exist haha you know what mean anyway so they should be problem and babies well if parents have to bring them they ll fall asleep there or the parents will have to leave early so would worry too much about the reception plus you have picked place where kids can go have their own fun great have you sent the invitations yet if not include note in the package stating that you would prefer no children at the ceremony and for that you have hired nanny for the duration so parents can leave their children with them to watch but make sure you include they are welcome at the reception as long as they are it is your day so you could not have children although it will make it harder for people to attend if you have sent invitations do you have wedding website you can post it on or you may have to touch base with everyone individually which would be bit of pain sending memo with the invitations would be easiest on you think this is perfectly reasonable if parents are upset about the ceremony thing which is completely unreasonable since you are providing suitable sitter then they can choose to skip it and just do the reception honestly would be psyched about the sitter during the ceremony worrying about kids making noise is little stressful for me as parent at wedding you are very thoughtful person hope your wedding day is everything you dreamed this is wonderful if they do appreciate it you do want them there there is nothing dread more than my kids being expected to attend weddings if they were all like this think weep for joy someone had suggested that if did include their kid at the ceremony they would just skip that part of the wedding personally pretty offended by that because the ceremony is the entire point of the night right so now all worried plus you know all the horror stories about some entitled moms just bucking the rules and bringing teething kids anyway that either going to offend someone or this whole thing is going to blow up in my face any suggestions on the wording of this also any idea for that cutoff age ve randomly picked but have no idea the difference between year old and an year old behavior wise lol you are the type of mom want to be friends with pretty sure none of his cousins or my cousins kids care at all about the ceremony my niece is super pumped to be flower girl but that because she has job 29 and barely have the attention span for wedding ceremonies ca imagine these poor kids care at all haha weddings are nightmare for kids the last one we went to before vowed never again they handed out bubbles as we walked in gave them to my kids before knew what was going on then told them not to use them until the end my jaw dropped to the floor you ve got to be f*in kidding me and and you think you can just hand them bubbles and tell them they ca use them we had to leave for which we were berated same thing at the reception when they decided to do staged dancing photos right away before everyone got drunk and looked horrid so they turn on the disco lights and the music insist that everyone especially the year old go out and dance while they take pictures for exactly minutes lights back on music off please clear the floor so we can have dinner yeah right we left screaming toddler in tow and were chastised for not eating the dinner they had paid for did mention we drove across three states to attend this wedding never never never again think your nanny idea for the ceremony is awesome my old daughter would have hard time sitting quietly for the ceremony but would love the reception with dancing and the zoo would totally appreciate the 30 minutes of child free time to enjoy the ceremony without having to constantly be on quiet the kid patrol be aware no matter what you do there will be people who completely ignore your wishes my cousin wedding was requested child free left my daughter with my husband at home and is somewhere ca go gt but we have decided to have cut off age for ceremony attendees so what is the cut off and what happens with families who have children both above and below your cut off little sister cindy has to go to the play area but big brother bobby is allowed to stay with mom and dad and go to the big ceremony that everyone is excited and dressed up for some kids will have no problems going off to play with the nannies and other kids will be terrified of leaving their parents especially if they have just traveled from out of town think you should make everyone aware of the option beforehand and maybe send them link to the children learning center so they can talk about it with their kids ahead of time then leave it up to the parents to know their kids best some kids will have meltdown if you try to drop them off with stranger but wo make peep sitting at the ceremony and vice versa think you need to decide if kids truly are invited or not there is no middle ground you can invite the kids and provide an alternative if the parents kids want it or you can invite the parents only and provide childcare for the kids having these weird cut offs for the ceremony only and kids only being quasi welcome is to be frank not very polite and will put cause more hurt feelings than just making real decision about who is and is not invited to the wedding as for letting parents know about your plans put all of the info on your wedding website and reach out to the families are you close to via phone or email and explain the situation so they can plan accordingly just say to make
